channel.title: Advice
channel.description:
For the past 3 days, I've had a lot of trouble sleeping. It started with a bad dream that I woke up in the middle of the night to. From then on I haven't gone to bed earlier then 2 A.M.
All I'm asking is does anyone have any sleeping techniques? Listening to soothing music?
Thanks.

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @_N_eon (N)eon
item.description:
@_N_eon wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:30, topic:439673”][quote author=Wet Dreamss link=topic=542367.msg3975063#msg3975063 date=1334545245]

God, 2am? I’m in bed no later than 9. How do you function?

9? That was my bed time when I was 6.

If you wake up at 4 then you should go to bed at 9, if not, stay up and party on mopar.
[/quote]

Sleep > Mopar[/quote]

Mopar > Sleep

Read full topic

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:22, topic:439673”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=542367.msg3974740#msg3974740 date=1334520447]

Thanks for the advice everyone… I usually eat Chips and drink soda at around 11, maybe that’s the problem. Lol…

yeah lololol, try drinking like a diet coke, caffeine free
[/quote]Or try drinking water

I don’t know why people don’t understand that you can actually drink water, and the crazy thing is, it’s not bad for you![/quote]
no way?!!??

but it’s flavorless.

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:13, topic:439673”][quote author=Wet Dreamss link=topic=542367.msg3974244#msg3974244 date=1334469649]

[quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=542367.msg3974228#msg3974228 date=1334468496]

I hit a bowl before I go to sleep every night, helps me fall asleep extremely fast and gives me nice semi lucid dreams.
An alternative would be to take a melatonin which is an all natural an untoxic herb pill that will help you fall asleep only if you’re lying down and trying to sleep or you could try reading a book which will make your eyes very tired.

ahahaha I like the first choice ^.^ but that’s a waste of a high…

OP:

Ask your mom to pick you up some nyquil or some melatonin, I usually have a hard time sleeping as well, I just take 4 nyquil about an hour before heading to bed (mostly to get high) and then you’ll be super tired. However if you don’t want to get high, just buy a bottle of melatonin 5 mg, and take 3 before bed.

If you’re looking for a more natural way to fall asleep, try taking a shower before going to bed. Or start to exercise during the day, you’ll find that exercise helps immensely with sleep
[/quote]How is it a waste of a high?
Bud is my riddlin… you don’t have to be awake to enjoy a high, sometimes I prefer to take a nap. If you have an abundance of it I say go ahead and enjoy the many different scenarios of it.
@ OP stop eating that crap before bed, that’s obviously your problem.
Drink water and get away from sodas…

that’s if you have an abundance of some greens. I sell so I can’t smoke my product that much x)
[/quote]Don’t ever admit you sell on the internet.
To be honest, if you’re selling you should be smoking more then a buyer… jus saying.
Especially if your being reupped. You’re still living in the mindset that bud is a drug used for getting fucked up lol…

edit ; another method i thoht of to fall asleep is physically exhausting yourself before going to sleep, maybe running around, doing some pull ups or push ups. Seems like a good way to get in shape and fall asleep.[/quote]
true, I used to smoke more, but I use it as a source of Income now, I make so much $ it’s not even funny.

Read full topic

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

Lin:

Don’t focus on your surroundings. I seem to be able to catch myself falling asleep because situations in my head will take their own path and I’ll start dreaming. Try thinking of scenarios and playing them out through your head. Conversations and dialogue seem to work the best for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Don’t focus on your surroundings. I seem to be able to catch myself falling asleep because situations in my head will take their own path and I’ll start dreaming. Try thinking of scenarios and playing them out through your head. Conversations and dialogue seem to work the best for me.

Read full topic
